name: Unchained
title: IRS Delays, Do Kwon Extradited & Ethereumâ€™s Big Win: Weekly Recap
text:
Synopsis
The cryptocurrency market continues to experience significant regulatory, legal, and market developments, with key events including the IRS tax reporting delay, Do Kwon's extradition, and Ethereum ETFs attracting substantial inflows, signaling ongoing institutional interest and maturation of the crypto ecosystem.

Key Insights
- IRS delays cryptocurrency cost basis reporting rules until January 1st, 2026, giving brokers more time to adapt to new tax reporting requirements
- Do Kwon, co-founder of Terraform Labs, has been extradited to the US to face criminal charges related to the Luna/UST collapse
- Ethereum ETFs closed 2024 with $2.7 billion in net inflows, with Fidelity's Ethereum Fund leading market investments
- 75% of Ethereum holders are now long-term investors, compared to 62% for Bitcoin
- Tether transferred $700 million in Bitcoin to its strategic reserve, bringing total Bitcoin holdings to over 83,000 BTC
- Swiss Bitcoin enthusiasts are launching a constitutional initiative to compel the Swiss National Bank to add Bitcoin to its reserves
- Celsius Network has appealed the rejection of its $444 million claim against bankrupt crypto exchange FTX
- USD0 stablecoin experienced a brief deppegging incident but quickly recovered
- Hyper Foundation launched token staking on its decentralized exchange mainnet
